Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which Democrats have cut school funding, stating that it has occurred "four times in the last 10 years before we came into office."
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the issue by not acknowledging the disputed nature of school funding figures and the different interpretations of whether funding increased or decreased during that time period.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that Democrats have cut school funding.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that any decrease in school funding during the specified time period can be attributed solely to Democrats, without considering other factors or parties involved.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for changes in school funding during the specified time period, such as economic factors or budget constraints, which are not addressed in the claim.
